Data Structures

class  CloseCondition

Detailed Description

An Alert is a Window, which displays a text and closes itself automatically after a certain time. An Alert can be opened modal or modeless. The time until the Alert closes itself can be specified by SetDelay or the constructor. When opened modeless and invoking Alert::Close() the Alert will not be closed until the set delay has been timed out.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN Alert::CloseImmediately (   ) 
 

Ignores the remaining delay and closes the alert immediately. Usually it should be avoided to close an alert this way, as it might make it impossible for the user to read the text.

void Alert::SetDelay (  INT  delay  ) 
 

Sets the delay in milliseconds until the alert should get closed. If the alert is still open and SetDelay is invoked again, the old delay will be replaced by the new one.

BOOLEAN Alert::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Used by Aragon to read out the windows property out of the resource parser. It is not allowed for an application developer to invoke this method in a direct manner.
